alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 2:54PM AKST until November 30 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, strong winds, and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Visibility less than one quarter mile at times. Winds gusting to 40 to 70 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...From 6 PM Tuesday to 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts may form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and lowest visibility are expected tonight from Point Lay south.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
